review_title: WAS a great place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Great benefits, pay, people and flexible hours.
cons: Bad upper management and too many layoffs lately.  The culture has drastically gone down hill and there are now signs of improvement anytime soon.

pros: Large Silicon-Valley inspired and well outfitted for good HR and benefits.  Still committed to innovation.
cons: Senior management isn't able to find the best-of-class in existing big iron and proprietary file systems history.  Commitments to all flash or cloud backup isn't creating a significant revenue stream to offset sinking margins in HW.  The cloud seems to be eating them, versus the other way around.

pros: They create the best data storage on the market and enable you to do your job without getting in the way.
cons: There are honestly not really any negatives.  They could use better marketing or inside sales support, but if you're good at what you do, it does not matter.

pros: Great company. No concerns. Amazing culture. Managers are very supportive and give great advice .One of the best to work for. Good vertical growth and stability
cons: Limited growth between departments. No cross departmental exposure. Not a very fast company and the technology is not cutting edge. Not much job satisfaction due to the work not being challenging enough

review_title: I enjoy working with my coworkers.
job_title: Software Engineer in Santa Clara, CA
pros: I like it that I am challenged by growing into new areas that have not used before in previous jobs in the past.
cons: It is not a start up company but the company still has that mentality and so it is run that way.

pros: Everyone at the company is helpful and willing to do what is necessary to get the job done for our customers.
cons: Growth at the company has led to change at the company.   The change has not always been smooth.  Change is needed to continue to grow.

pros: Fantastic culture and great all around work environment.  Extremely innovative company and market leader in our industry.
cons: Success is very muhc tied to the territory and account base that you have.  Typically you'll have a few year run in a particular patch and then the goal is raised to a point that makes it very difficult to succeed.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: Supportive engineering management - they generally were once engineers themselves and can relate to situations and advise on "who to call for what."
cons: Sales management - where do they get these people? After years in a thriving customer situation, they can be disruptive to the very thing that brings in their paycheck - a continuing revenue stream.

pros:
good compensation to start
very good benefits 
flexible hours and some telecommuting
volunteer time off to allow for community service
a good place to go to if you are close to retirement
cons:
technologies and process used in development are out-dated
rarely promote from within, rather hire from competitors who bring in their buddies
elaborate performance review system that rewards only a few (why bother?)
biggest growth is off-shore

pros: The company has some great benefits and in general its a good work environment. The executives go above and beyond to communicate.  You can also expect to gain a variety of experience.
cons: The work life balance isn't good and you aren't likely to be recognized for your accomplishments.  But what company does that anyway

review_title: Company is going through rough time
pros: Company's culture is good and employees work in a good team envionment.
cons:
* Company is not growing as it should do. CEO has been changed but don't see much efforts to turn it around again.
* In current situation many employees are leaving the company and some of them are good employees. There are no major efforts to retain people.

pros: It is a good experience to work at.  You should all work there if you are planning to interview for this job position.  They give good benefits and they also have a fair job salary.
cons: Some of the cons of this company are that sometimes they dont give overtime.  Other than that this company is a good company to work at.

pros: People are supportive and it feels like a community.  There is a willingness to remodel and move to the emerging markets.
cons: The roadmap is not clear.  For more than 2 years, there has been lots of layoffs and contant uncertainity.

pros: Great communication from Leadership! Fairly good benefits and pay. Open door policy.
cons: Difficult to get things done with layers of decision makers while no one wants to be accountable and make decision. Can be very political in some departments.

pros: there is a great work life balance is what you get when you are woking with netapp  as well as a respect for work you do.
cons: there is as such no disadvantage of working with netapp it is a great place to work until you are giving your best to company

review_title: Stock price looks great, but it's coming at the expense of employees
pros: Nice benefits if you're at Corporate in Sunnyvale.
cons:
If you're in sales, good times. If not, pay attention! You're getting squeezed into oblivion. HR is NOT your friend.
NetApp culture is dead and gone.
Senior Sales executives are making ego based IT infrastructure decisions.

pros: Great products and innovation which allows for work life balance by not having to be catching up with support issues. Great Gartner positioning.
cons: Marketing is weak. Mostly around messaging and enabling partners to sell quickly.  NetApp lost a lot of strong presales technical talent in the last few years to competitors;  Culture has enabled some to just cruise and not be challenged although many have been cleaned up, there is still work to be done.

review_title: Some departments are not the greatest place to work
pros: Some of the best reasons to work for NetApp would be the benefits and location only.
cons: Some of the downsides to working at NetApp would be the internal politics, people not being flexible and the hallway gossip.  There is no privacy so don't expect confidentiality. There are long hours and very little downtime.

review_title: Overall good company. However there are some incompetent members of management
pros: Great benefits, good overall company, great perks, great culture. I really like working for NetApp as a company, the culture here is great.
cons: The company has grown rapidly over the past 10 years, as a result some incompetent managers have been promoted rapidly as well.

review_title: Great place to work - if you can handle it
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros:
Netapp has a great culture. Many perks that other companies don't offer and wouldn't even think of offering (Beer Bash every friday).

Company is large enough to accommodate various career paths

Technical staff gets to put their work behind them when they finish their shift. No afterhours calls
cons: Support Staff is very lean. Essentially doing the job of 1.5-2 support engineers. Can get overwhelming at times. Not for the weak!

job_title: Member of Technical Staff II in Bangalore
pros: You will get to work with amazing people from different corners of the globe at this tech-friendly organization. NetApp employees are benefitted from a  a very good work-life balance during their career.
cons: Job security points some questions at the credibility of one the "Great Place To Work". At times you will find yourself bound to boring engineering processes and meetings.

review_title: Poor work culture, incompetent senior management
job_title: Member Technical Staff, Software in Bangalore
pros: Good pay, work environment, Cafetaria, Pantry.
cons: Process takes back seat when it comes to execution. Senior management has no vision for future, No clarity on the road map and even if it is there, it moves from north to south every now and then. Group-ism is at core. If you don't find a god father, you are finished.

pros: I've been with NetApp a little over 7 years, and have moved up to better positions 4 times in those years.  Great upward mobility potential at this company!
cons: I can't think of a single con.  My experience working at NetApp has been nothing short of stellar for 7+ years.

review_title: Cpmpany that provides you opportunities if you put in the effort
job_title: Senior Logistics Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Allows an individual to expand on their skill sets and experience.  Creates opportunties and expands scope.
cons: If the Director level, empowered employees and managers to make decision without fear of loosing thier josbs.  Work together more to open doors and suppport managers.

job_title: Software Engineering Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Great people and opportunities. Great leadership provided by Senior Engineers. The pay is competitive and the benefits are good. Many good people have been attracted to NetApp, because of the "Great Places to Work" ratings.
cons: Culture is being eroded by politics and layers of less than effective directors and VPs. Most of the good technical directors have left the company leaving behind technical leaders who are more political motivated than technically savvy.

pros: For the first several years, it was great.  Great culture, amazing people, high morale.  I was proud to work here and recommended anyone who wanted to join.
cons: In the past 1 1/2 years,  the company has gone downhill.  Executive decisions are way off the mark. They flip flop in their go to market strategy and the leaders they are bringing on these days are really destroying the amazing culture it used to have.

review_title: not a bad place to work, but not like it used to be
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Raleigh, NC
pros: great colleagues, great benefits, good pay, lots of training available
cons: confusion about direction of company, uncertainty about the next bid thing that will keep the company afloat, used to have a lot better leadership and understanding of what it meant to set appropriate expectations

job_title: Senior Technical Marketing Engineer in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great culture, many smart people. Flexible working hours and great team environment. No until left NetApp, I realize how great NetApp culture is. I will always have NetApp blue in my heart.
cons: Hire middle management from external who has no idea about storage, cloud and flash. No backfill on some important positions.

pros: There are a few knowledgeable/hard-working/helpful people around. One could WFH when needed without too much hassle. HR policies in place to get employees some kind of training every year. NetApp University tries to get info/videos/trainings on various products available to all employees.
cons: office politics; team leads ready to gobble up credit for your work; managers turning a blind eye even when informed of the issues.

pros: Good benefits and excellent exposure to huge UK organisations. Lovely office in Uxbridge and relaxed working environment.
cons: No real identity and regular organisational changes creates an uneasy atmosphere. Some great people working there however there is are some employees who are not great to work alongside.

pros: Senior leadership has the vision to move the company forward.  Executing well on a plan  to position NetApp in a Cloud connected world.
cons: Very competitive market place with many vendors sharing the same vision.  Moving from a traditional enterprise, on-prem sale to supporting cloud initiatives is going to take some time.

job_title: Channel Development Manager in Nashville, TN
pros:
Senior Executives willingness to engage and support at any level
Support for employees to “give back” -  40 hours of paid volunteer time 
Compensation plan for Commission based employees provides lucrative base plus commission with acceleration targets 
Great healthcare, dental and vision benefits
401k with company match up to 6%
ESPP program
cons: Difficult to maintain consistency and partner relationships with semi-annual and annual channel realignment strategy

pros: Excellent direction and strategy.  Management knows what direction to focus the company.  Good communication between departments and mid-level management is capable.
cons: Lots of people who are just clocking hours and collecting a paycheck.  Innovation is lacking and recognition of the product environment and product landscape needs work.

pros:
Flexible Timings,
ESPP is a real benefit
RSUs definitely help
cons:
New leadership at 2nd line manager levels spoil the culture
High level of Micromanagement prevails, 
Too much process overheads and no clear vision or Roadmap
Not as it was in 2010, very diluted and not a good place to work for now

review_title: NetApp is one of best companies to work for
pros: NetApp is a very progressive-minded company, and I would love to work for them again, given the opportunity.
cons: Storage Sales individuals need to sell more than just the storage.  There are many additional software offerings which can further enhance a NetApp acquisition, and customers will pay for the added functionality when it improves operational efficiency, as NetApp software will do.

pros: Good CEO, nice perks, 5 days of paid volunteer time / year.  I think NetApp overall is a good company to work for.  Strong top leadership (Tom Georgens, Tom Mendoza, Dave Hitz).
cons: Some pockets of high amount of politics.  The E-series group is still by and large run by former LSI management team, and seems to be completely separate from the rest of the company.

review_title: The company is excellent in several sectors but lacks critical direction.
job_title: Senior Product Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: NetApp has great software solutions. Mid-management has a lot of strong players. Good hours and compensation. Strong commitment to improving processes. Good benefits package.
cons: Company lacking in direction with regards to third-party strategy, both around resellers and OEM. Having difficulty determining business strategy for cloud, transitioning to a SW-based model and commoditization of storage. Several stumbles along the way.

review_title: Good work culture, extremely crappy code
job_title: Member Technical Staff, Software in Bangalore
pros: Employee friendly, Beer bash, Snacks.
cons:
Code is mostly is written in an haphazard manner, no standards followed or maintained. As there is a saying, 'One man's hack is other man day job'; most of the code written at netapp is more of a hack and has no neat design. Netapp's core Os is monolithic: that speaks volumes about the code quality.
Forceful vacation twice a year.

job_title: Software QA Engineer Intern in Vancouver, BC
pros:
Offers plenty of room to grow your skills, not restricted. As an intern you take as advanced a level of work as you want, or that you think you can handle.
Kept me on as part time following the conclusion of my internship.
cons: Rounds of layoffs not uncommon.

pros: Everything. I have been an SDR at a different company - and this one is way better. The management is awesome. There is no micro-management whatsoever. Just do your job, and do a good job at it, and you will be fine. Nobody breathing down your neck, like other jobs.
cons: Sometimes the lack of management can be distracting because you talk so much with your peers. But that is only one's own fault.

review_title: Once a great place.  Now on a downward spiral
job_title: Anonymous in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: NetApp had a great culture and was innovative back in the day...  There are a lot of good people still at NetApp that really care about the company.
cons: NetApp is a sinking ship.  Poor leadership, slow innovation, missed opportunities (Cloud) and latest round of layoffs has completely demoralized everyone.  Many talented people have left on their own as the writing is on the walls.  Employees having hard time trusting leadership.

job_title: Software QA Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Flexible, great people, and a few great products. Still opportunities for advancement and it looks like the company is finally starting to turn around.
cons: The elongated turnaround of the company is taking time which makes it hard for current employees to keep hope, especially as frequent layoffs and attrition eat away at the employee base

review_title: Great place to work with zero sense of security
pros: Good pay, flexible management style allowing employee to excel.
cons:
Used to have great, positive culture. Not so much today.
Fires 10% of workforce annually, each May (start of fiscal year). Horrible vibe because everybody feels at risk, and harsh termination conditions.

pros: good culture and nice people, However I have decided to move on for my own good. Staying here 5+ years is long enough.
cons: Welfare is no good, poor medical. And you have to get used to having layoffs for every single year.

pros:
good work life balance
campus is good
cons:
-works on ancient technologies with slow growth
-middle management is bloating up and usually doesn't care about employees
- managers are worshiped and trusted
-still stuck in the old style of management
- most of the positive reviews will be by managers here and not by engineers

review_title: No1 worst place to work in the world
pros: Free croissants on Fridays, but they are usually cold and out dated.
cons:
-Casual racist jokes are tolerated.
-No team work.
-Discrimination among employees of different religions.

review_title: Started as a small and great company ... but as in all growing companies, its starting to lose its way.
pros: A great company begins with great leadership. This is a company that is growing and it has very high energy levels from top to bottom.
cons: There is very little career development opportunities for the middle and ground level. Annual promotions happen mainly at the top.

review_title: An unbelievable company with amazing workers & upper management
pros: There are multiple reasons that make NetApp amazing! For starters everyone that works here is always willing to lend a helping hand. On top of that you will find some of the brightest around the tech industry here.
cons: Due to the nature of the business (data storage) the age range of most employees is a lot higher than most tech companies.

review_title: Great Place to work , good work ,flexi timings and awesome culture
job_title: Member of Technical Staff I in Bangalore

Totally flat culture, easy accessibilty to top strata of management

Growth is a little limited
Possibility of getting into a comfort zone mentality

review_title: Global co. with solid leadership and growth opps
job_title: Sales Operations Program Manager in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: NetApp provides you with the salary, benefits, etc. so that you can give your 100% to your work. Most employees don't find micromanagement to be a problem, and there's definitely work / life flexibility to be had...IF you can get the job done in 40 hours.

review_title: One of the best place to work for if you want to make career in Storage !!
job_title: Member of Technical Staff II in Bangalore

review_title: Was a great company but slowed down

cons: VP level and above is more of a club. People that do not deserve the position are there. RTP is a joke run by people who in other companies would be glorified SE's.

review_title: Used to be a great place to work
pros: Decent work life balance for certain roles.  Benefits are reasonable, although declining by the year.
cons: Extensive politics, limited career growth opportunities.  Used to be a really great place to work, now an average place to work that talks a lot about culture.  Not the open culture that it claims to be, there are consequences for speaking up.

review_title: NetApp's Forbes 100 top company rating standard is "very overrated".  The benefits/work environment is overrated.

Benefits are average.  Raises and Health benefits are nothing to talk about. 
Company states high values especially to employees but no real action.

review_title: NetApp is an amazing company to work for.
job_title: Technical Engineer in Lake Mary, FL
pros: Everyone always willing to help if needed. NetApp cares about it's employees and works with each of them to ensure they are comfortable and happy while in a work environment.
cons: You are providing tech support over the phone and with NetApp being worldwide sometimes there is a slight language barrier.

review_title: If you daily want to have a feeling of loosing your job - Join NetApp

pros:
Beer Bash

WORST PLACE TO WORK

pros: They place a strong emphasis on maintaining their culture. They care a lot about being a great place to work. Great flexibility with hours, schedule, and most of the executives are innovative and supportive.
cons: Don't have as many benefits as other companies in the area - no child care, no free meals, no help with transportation (it would be great to have a bus to the East Bay like other tech companies).

job_title: Mid Level Herder in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Good health benefits. Employees are treated with respect. Nice campus. Some great talent, unfortunately they are leaving in droves.
cons: No clear direction/vision from the leadership team, too many social/political promotions, annual layoffs, lack luster raises and RSUs, product not competitive, too much political non-performing dead weight, too many re-orgs.

pros: Positive vibe, great work life balance, interesting projects, down to Earth culture, competitive compensation, and a promising future. Everything you could want in an employer.
cons: Given recent history, the company is a bit quick on the layoff trigger. Not necessarily the right way to pacify shareholders.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in El Dorado, KS
pros: A very collaborative culture; very little "politics"; great pay and benefits; interesting work.
cons: The company is struggling to be able to grow and support it's cost structure. Forced vacation during Christmas and July 4th means reduced ability to take vacation days when YOU want to take them.

review_title: Not what it used to be
job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: it was truly one of the best place to work for before I left the company.  Non toxic work environment, positive culture, everyone that I worked with were professional, competent, plenty of opportunity to grow and strive
cons: we couldn't compete, couldn't gain market share, started to shrink the workforce, cutting cost, loosing good, talent people, morale got worse overtime

job_title: Senior Systems Engineering Manager in Bellevue, WA
pros: Love the Culture at NetApp. Feedback is accepted from any level. Always looking to improve processes and make thing more streamlined. Our leadership is able to deal with adversity head on and make good choices.
cons: The market doesn’t understand us. The customers that own NetApp love it, but often put us in a box. The breadth of solutions is unmatched and I just wish others knew it and accepted it.

review_title: Think Long and hard before joining this lot...nothing is as it seems
pros: Fresh bananas in the office
cons: Very weak middle management. You won't get paid the commission you expect if you're in sales. The company fails to uphold its own code of conduct. Everything takes forever to get done, if at all. Very arrogant and ineffective management and lots of people walking around full of their own self-importance. So much so you'd think they'd just cured cancer

pros: culture, highly collaborative, focus on customers, focus on growth - company values are lived out across the organization.   Company is not afraid to take risks to advance with customers & grow.
cons: Nothing more than other companies - we all work through issues, conflicting objectives, and experience the occaisional policitcal move to get ahead....NetApp is a really solid company, well run, with high regard & respect for individuals.

review_title: Ever growing company, with growth pains.
pros: Good company, great place to work.  Very open culture.  Always plenty of new stuff to learn, new things to do.
cons: Losing some of its magic over time, good people leave and replacements are not as good.  Glory days seem to have past.

review_title: Truly a great place to work. The colleagues and understanding management make it a great experience.
job_title: Software Engineer III in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: The culture of the company truly makes it a nice to place to work everyday. People are understanding, talented and multi-talented. The executive and engineering management is one of the best in the industry.
cons: The  entire engineering organization works on building a single comprehensive operating system. Due to which engineers might have frustrations with the slow release times, complex and inter-dependent code.

review_title: Great place to work with some growing pains
pros: Minimal management interference, dynamic environment with a fantastic culture.  The company has a great product and continues to grow in the market.
cons: Lots of competitive pressures and noise in the market with "me too" players springing up everywhere.  The more MBA's they hire, the more programs and initiatives there are that slow down the sales process

review_title: Great company with outdated salary ranges in Bay area
pros:
Good work life balance.
Awesome people to work.
Lots of growth opportunities for engineers.
High visibility.
Reduced politics compared to other companies.
cons:
Outdated salary range. They *Must* have to consider bay area salary ranges otherwise they will lose talent for sure.

I also got this feeling from my other colleagues as well.

review_title: A very good company to work for
pros: Very good technical company, explores a lot of opportunities for enthusiasts. Provides a great work life balance. Most of employee friendly company i had worked so far.
cons: Some bureaucracy at some senior engineering positions. Because of that you might face some issues about the compensation. Under pressure decisions were always taken wrong and led to a bad experience from higher mgmt.

review_title: Great pay, great people, great benefits, great opportunities, and cool technology

cons: Make sure you keep up on all assigned work. Timely response is critical to everything you work on. Need to be very  good at managing your workload. Communication skills are vital.

review_title: Too expensive just selling Xyrotech (now seagate)  hardware

review_title: Good pay, good benefits and fun, smart people

review_title: Great job, but I'm not confident about NetApp's future

Persistent, and increasing rounds of layoff, quarter after quarter in attempts to hide the real problem of the company: lack of innovation and hence declining revenues.

pros: Laid back atmosphere, supportive direct management, good  health care, generous 401k match, flex time, training and stimulating work environment.

job_title: Vice President in San Jose, CA
pros: Great culture. Good to employees. Most people worked very hard to make a difference.
cons: To focused on the culture and not enough on their customers. Missed a big chance to make a difference in the marketplace because they were too internally focused and not listening to the market changes.

pros: NetApp gives it's employees ample opportunities to build their skill set.  It's a big company with a small company feel.  In addition to being able to pursue your passions, the work/life balance is priceless.
cons: NetApp has strong fundamentals but if you choose your company based on what the market thinks it's worth you may not like NetApp.

review_title: Interesting work with great people and good culture

cons: Many layoffs in recent years. I was let go in the second one of CY2016. The company has struggled to keep up with the changing markets and customer needs.

pros:

pros: If you get with the right team the atmosphere is great!

pros: Empowered at the field at all positions.  Autonomy and trust given at all levels.  Bottom up driven company as opposed to corporate culture like at peer competitors.

pros: Size of company is good enough to get good work and recognition, unlike big companies like Microsoft.

pros: NetApp is good company overall and have very good talented people on-board. Product features are really good.

pros: Benefits are good; most people are willing to help

review_title: Great beginnings, but losing the plot

pros: Most of the management is great. Work life balance is fantastic. The company does a great job of encouraging fitness with the onsite fitness center and groups that compete together in various sports.

review_title: Negative outlook and demotivating work environment
job_title: Member of Technical Staff QA in Bangalore
pros: Nothing much to say. One can get very good life balance (due to less work). Not much work will make you lazy and complacent. Anybody can get rewards for doing any stupid small work. Too frequent team lunches without any reason to celebrate!
cons:
Old technology in most of the products, maintenance work mostly. Work content is reducing release after release. 
High attrition with no back-filling from past 18 months. Layoffs every 10-12 months. Lot of good people have left the organization themselves or asked to go. 
Senior experienced team members and managers are always on the threat of layoffs.
Dramatized mailers coming out on layoffs 3-4 months before the event spreads fear and complete negative uncertainty on the peoples mind. 
Some of the old timers waiting for their names in layoff list to get the severance package.

QA is not sufficiently staffed (poor dev:qa ratio), not enough work for some dev teams and too much work for most of the qa engineers. 
Most of the senior engineers are lethargic, laid-back, demotivated, lack technical skills and avoid any new initiatives or changes.
Negative mindset throughout the organization. Talks & rumors about  layoffs goes on and on every day. 
Too much money is spent of events & team lunches without any reasons to celebrate.
No communication from Directors and senior managers on the vision and roadmap (which looks like doesn't exist)

My suggestion to anyone looking for job opportunity in Netapp is not to purse whether you are fresher or experienced. Freshers may not have layoff threat here, but they will not have much to learn and soon they will become lazy and complacent. Senior experienced folks, well, you never know when your number will come in the next layoffs.

review_title: We are afraid of loosing our jobs, and eager to leave before we are laid-off.
pros: Paycheck has not bounced.  We have a lot of idle time to be with freinds and family because there is not much work to do.  Everyone seems to be waiting for the next lay-off, and this slow pace of work is very satisfying.
cons: Environment is tough, as everyone is on edge that they will be the next one to be laid off and this leads to backstabbing.  If you are an older worker, and not at the Director level, you will be laid off in the next round.  In the last round, the stronger workers were let go as management feared that they would replace them at a lower wage.  Resignations are rampant, all of the talent is leaving in fear of job security.  In California, housing is so expensive that a person needs a stable job to pay the mortgage and netApp can not provide the stability.  Customer's should be worried as they made a sizable investment in NetApp technology and now the people who developed these products have resigned / laid off.  How can you expect them to migrate to NetApp's cloud (which is expensive) when the company is failing.  A note to all recruiters, every coworker that I know wants to leave netapp, even for 20% less pay.  Please do not considered a laid-off NetApp employee as a weak employee - they are actually the stronger ones that the weaker managers feared.
